description: Dataset for predicting whether images on Internet pages are advertisements. Features encode image geometry, URL phrases, anchor text, and surrounding text to classify images as ads or non-ads.

creator.name: Nicholas Kushmerick
creator.note: STANDARD encoding as mentioned in Kushmerick, 1999

missing_values_rate: 28% of instances have missing continuous features

feature_description.continuous_features: 3 features encoding image geometry (height, width, aspect ratio)
feature_description.binary_features: 1555 features indicating presence of specific words/phrases in URL, image URL, alt text, anchor text, and surrounding text
feature_description.missing_interpretation: Missing values should be interpreted as 'unknown'

use_case: Ad blocking, web content filtering, online advertising analysis, web page classification, content recommendation
preprocessing: Features extracted from image properties and surrounding HTML/text context
performance_considerations: High dimensionality (1558 features), sparse binary features, missing values in continuous features
advantages: Real-world web mining problem, comprehensive feature extraction, practical application
challenges: High dimensionality, sparsity, missing values, concept drift in web content
research_applications: High-dimensional classification, sparse data mining, web content analysis, feature selection
historical_context: Early dataset in web mining and online advertising detection
openml_status: Deactivated due to validation errors but still accessible

citations.author: Nicholas Kushmerick
citations.title: Learning to remove Internet advertisements
citations.venue: Proceedings of the Third International Conference on Autonomous Agents

original_source.creator: Nicholas Kushmerick
original_source.publication: Nicholas Kushmerick: Learning to remove Internet advertisements

columns.name: continuous_features
columns.semantic_description: 3 features encoding image geometry (height, width, aspect ratio)

columns.name: binary_features
columns.semantic_description: 1555 features indicating presence of specific words/phrases in URL, image URL, alt text, anchor text, and surrounding text

columns.name: missing_interpretation
columns.semantic_description: Missing values should be interpreted as 'unknown'

dataset_history: Dataset history not available for Internet-Advertisements
inference_notes: Challenges: High dimensionality, sparsity, missing values, concept drift in web content. Advantages: Real-world web mining problem, comprehensive feature extraction, practical application. Applications: High-dimensional classification, sparse data mining, web content analysis, feature selection. Use Case: Ad blocking, web content filtering, online advertising analysis, web page classification, content recommendation
